alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles; Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 29 at 11:02PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by moderate to locally heavy rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including eastern Ventura County and the coast, valleys, and mountains of Los Angeles County. * WHEN...Until 500 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall could trigger shallow debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars such as the Palisades, North, Elsmere, Bobcat, Dam, and Ranch2 burn areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1100 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to locally heavy rain falling across eastern Ventura County and most of Los Angeles County. Rainfall rates between 0.25 and 0.45 inch per hour have been observed, highest across the Bobcat burn area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. In addition, roadway flooding is possible, especially in low- lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Long Beach, Simi Valley, Malibu, Griffith Park, Burbank, Universal City, Hollywood, Downtown Los Angeles, Pasadena, North Hollywood, Alhambra, Beverly Hills, Van Nuys, Culver City, Mount Wilson, Inglewood and Encino. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas, if it is safe to do so. The rain may trigger shallow mud and debris flows, minor rock falls, and flooding capable of localized damage, especially in steep terrain in and near burn scars. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
